member.name: T:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Cohesive.BondSlipMaterial
member.summary: cohesion only friction type response in shear separation mode (with kinematic hardening like behaviour). Linear elastic behaviour in normal mode Authors Gerasimos Sotiropoulos

member.name: M:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Cohesive.BondSlipMaterial.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: Creates and object of the BondSlipCohMat material class.
member.param: Elastic stifness in the shear direction.
Tangent stifness after yielding in the shear direction.
Elastic stifness in the normal direction.
Tolerance for the ued iterative procedure followed for the calculation of the next traction slip point.

member.name: M:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Cohesive.BondSlipMaterial.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: /// Creates and object of the BondSlipCohMat material class.
member.param: Yield traction in the shear direction.
Yield slip in the shear direction.
Percentage of the ratio: Elastic stifness in the shear direction/Tangent stifness after yielding in the shear direction.
Ttraction of a characteristic traction slip point in the normal direction.
Slip of a characteristic traction slip point in the normal direction.
Tolerance for the ued iterative procedure followed for the calculation of the next traction slip point.

member.name: T:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.ElasticMaterial2D
member.summary: It is an implementation of a linear elastic isotropic constitutive law for 2D finite elements.

member.summary: Creastes a new object of class.

member.summary: Returns the constitutive matrix of the material for the current strain state

member.summary: Returns the stresses of this material for the current strain state.

member.summary: Clears the saved stress strain point connected to the last converged analysis step. Currently not a valid operation.

member.name: M:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.ElasticMaterial2D.ClearStresses
member.summary: Clears stresses - Currently not a valid operation.

member.name: M:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.ElasticMaterial2D.CreateState
member.summary: Saves the current stress strain state of the material (after convergence of the iterative solution process for a given loading step).

member.summary: Returns the ID of the material class indicating a specific material law implementation.

member.name: M:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.ElasticMaterial2D.IsCurrentStateDifferent
member.summary: Returns a boolean indicating if the constitutive matrix of the material has changed for the current iteratively update of the deformation state.

member.name: M:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.ElasticMaterial2D.ResetModified
member.summary: Resets the boolean that indicates if the constitutive matrix of the material has changed for the current iteratively update of the deformation state.

member.name: M:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.ElasticMaterial2D.System#ICloneable#Clone
member.summary: Creates a clone of material object with the same parameters.

member.name: M:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.ElasticMaterial2D.Clone
member.summary: Creates a clone of material object with the same parameters.

member.name: P:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.ElasticMaterial2D.Coordinates
member.summary: Returns coordinates. Currently not a valid operation.

member.name: T:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.ElasticPlaneStrainVonMises
member.summary: Calculates the equivalent von Mises stress according to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Von_Mises_yield_criterion#Summary. For plane strain conditions, the components s23 = s31 = 0, but s33 = E*v / ((1+v)*(1-2*v)) * (e11+e22). Therefore it depends on the Young modulus E and Poisson ratio v. Authors: Serafeim Bakalakos

member.name: M:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.ElasticPlaneStrainVonMises.#ctor(MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.ElasticMaterial2D)
member.summary: Sets the Young's modulus and the Poisson's ratio to be used
member.param: the elastic isotropic material to set the parameters from.

member.name: M:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.ElasticPlaneStrainVonMises.Calculate(System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Calculates the equivalent von Mises stress for plain strain conditions and given strain and stress tensor.

member.name: T:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.IVonMisesStress2D
member.summary: Calculates the von Mises equivalent stress given the Cauchy stress. Authors: Serafeim Bakalakos

member.name: M:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.IVonMisesStress2D.Calculate(System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.param: Its components are: e11, e22, e12
Its components are: s11, s22, s12.

member.name: T:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.PlaneStressVonMises
member.summary: Calculates the equivalent von Mises stress according to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Von_Mises_yield_criterion#Summary. For plane stress conditions, the computation doesn't depend on the material properties. Authors: Serafeim Bakalakos

member.name: M:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.PlaneStressVonMises.Calculate(System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Calculates the equivalent von Mises stress for plane stress conditions.

member.name: T:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Planar.StressState2D
member.summary: Authors: Dimitris Tsapetis

member.name: T:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Shells.IShellSectionMaterial

member.name: T:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Shells.ShellElasticMaterial2D
member.summary: An elastic isotropic material to be used in shell finite element formulations that take into account the Kirchhof Love hypothesis

member.name: T:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Shells.ShellElasticMaterial2Dtransformationb
member.summary: Isotropic elastic shell material that accounts for no out of plane shear deformation Authors Gerasimos Sotiropoulos

member.summary: An elastic isotropic material to be used in shell finite element formulations that take into account the Reissner Mindlin hypothesis Authors Gerasimos-Serafeim

member.name: T:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.Shells.ShellElasticSectionMaterial2D
member.summary: An elastic isotropic material to be used in shell finite element formulations that take into account the Kirchhof Love hypothesis.

member.name: T:MGroup.Constitutive.Structural.StructuralDof
member.summary: Degrees of freedom corresponding to the movement of a point/body along or around the 3 possible axes. Implements enum pattern. Authors: Serafeim Bakalakos
